intro: Blaeria stolzii, commonly known as the Stolzii bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and pinnately compound leaves. Its fruit is a short, inflated silique that contains several seeds. Blaeria stolzii is typically found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
